name: Montauk Daisy
climate: Montauk Daisy prefers temperate climates with mild summers and cold winters.
This plant is well-suited to coastal regions with cool and dry conditions.
It can tolerate a range of climates but does best where temperatures are moderate.
Avoid excessively hot and dry climates, which can stress the Montauk Daisy.
sunlight: Montauk Daisy thrives in full sun, needing at least six hours of direct sunlight daily.
Partial shade can be tolerated, but too much shade reduces flowering significantly.
For optimal growth and blooming, place in a location receiving consistent sunlight.
Avoid placing in deep shade as it can become leggy with poor flowering performance.
watering: Water regularly during the growing season but allow the soil to dry between waterings.
This plant tolerates drought well once established, requiring less frequent irrigation.
Over-watering can lead to root rot; ensure good drainage to prevent waterlogging.
In cooler months, reduction in watering as the plant enters dormancy is beneficial.
soil: Montauk Daisy grows well in rich, well-drained soil with good organic matter.
It can adapt to poorer soils but thrives in fertile ground with good nutrients.
Ensure the soil is not compacted and drains water efficiently to prevent root issues.
Moderate pH levels, between neutral to slightly alkaline, are suitable for this plant.
extra_care_tip: Trim back after flowering in the fall to maintain a compact shape and prevent legginess.
Applying a layer of mulch around the base helps to retain moisture and regulate soil temperature.
